Detailed Description

Main class of the application

Beside the implementation of some methods of the class SingleFrameApplication, which is extended to personalize its behaviour, this class contains:

  • A method (preferenceChange), which implements the interface PreferenceChangeListener, called each time that the values of one or more preferences are modified (by methods of this or other classes of the application, which register this class as their PreferenceChangeListener)

  • Methods to get the values of the various preferences

  • A method (generateTrainingSet) to (re)generate the training set every time that it is necessary

  • A method (readDocument) to read the title and the text of a document from the file system, and from these create an instance of the class Document

Author:
Salvo Danilo Giuffrida (giuffsalvo@hotmail.it, salvodanilogiuffrida@gmail.com)
See also:
SingleFrameApplication

Definition at line 50 of file DocumentClassifierApp.java.

void documentclassifier.DocumentClassifierApp.preferenceChange ( PreferenceChangeEvent  event  ) 

Method that implements the interface 'PreferenceChangeListener'.

It is invoked each time a preference of the node represented by the variable 'preferenze' is modified, changing the value and/or the state of one or more components of the JDialog PreferencesDialog. When a preference is modified, this method updates the value of the corresponding variable inside this class.

Parameters:
event The PreferenceChangeEvent that must be managed.

String [] documentclassifier.DocumentClassifierApp.readDocument ( InputStream  IS  )  throws Exception [protected]

Method that reads from an InputStream (FileInputStream, NetworkInputStream, ecc..) the title and the text of the document associated with it, using an appropriate scraper, and it returns them inside a vector of strings (position 0: Title, position 1: Text).

Parameters:
IS The InputStream from where reading the document.
Returns:
The title and the text of the extracted document, inside a String vector made of two elements.
Exceptions:
Exception

static List<Class> documentclassifier.DocumentClassifierApp.getClassesForPackage ( String  packagename  )  throws ClassNotFoundException [static, protected]

Method that returns the list of classes inside the package provided in input.

Parameters:
packagename The name of the package we want to know the classes of.
Returns:
The list of classes (as instances of the class Class) present inside the specified package.
Exceptions:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException 

Definition at line 259 of file DocumentClassifierApp.java.

00259                                                                                                         {
00260         // This will hold a list of directories matching the pckgname. 
00261         // There may be more than one if a package is split over multiple jars/paths
00262         List<Class> classes = new ArrayList<Class>();
00263         ArrayList<File> directories = new ArrayList<File>();
00264         try {
00265             ClassLoader cld = Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader();
00266             if (cld == null) {
00267                 throw new ClassNotFoundException("Can't get class loader.");
00268             }
00269             // Ask for all resources for the path
00270             Enumeration<URL> resources = cld.getResources(packagename.replace('.', '/'));
00271             while (resources.hasMoreElements()) {
00272                 URL res = resources.nextElement();
00273                 if (res.getProtocol().equalsIgnoreCase("jar")) {
00274                     JarURLConnection conn = (JarURLConnection) res.openConnection();
00275                     JarFile jar = conn.getJarFile();
00276                     for (JarEntry e : Collections.list(jar.entries())) {
00277 
00278                         if (e.getName().startsWith(packagename.replace('.', '/')) && e.getName().endsWith(".class") && !e.getName().contains("$")) {
00279                             String className =
00280                                     e.getName().replace("/", ".").substring(0, e.getName().length() - 6);
00281                             //System.out.println(className);
00282                             classes.add(Class.forName(className));
00283                         }
00284                     }
00285                 } else {
00286                     directories.add(new File(URLDecoder.decode(res.getPath(), "UTF-8")));
00287                 }
00288             }
00289         } catch (NullPointerException x) {
00290             throw new ClassNotFoundException(packagename + " does not appear to be a valid package (Null pointer exception)");
00291         } catch (UnsupportedEncodingException encex) {
00292             throw new ClassNotFoundException(packagename + " does not appear to be a valid package (Unsupported encoding)");
00293         } catch (IOException ioex) {
00294             throw new ClassNotFoundException("IOException was thrown when trying to get all resources for " + packagename);
00295         }
00296 
00297         // For every directory identified capture all the .class files
00298         for (File directory : directories) {
00299             if (directory.exists()) {
00300                 // Get the list of the files contained in the package
00301                 String[] files = directory.list();
00302                 for (String file : files) {
00303                     // we are only interested in .class files
00304                     if (file.endsWith(".class")) {
00305                         // removes the .class extension
00306                         classes.add(Class.forName(packagename + '.' + file.substring(0, file.length() - 6)));
00307                     }
00308                 }
00309             } else {
00310                 throw new ClassNotFoundException(packagename + " (" + directory.getPath() +
00311                         ") does not appear to be a valid package");
00312             }
00313         }
00314         return classes;
00315     }

String documentclassifier.DocumentClassifierApp.getTrainingSetDirectory ( boolean  defaultValue  )  [protected]

The following methods allow read access to the internal variables of this class that correspond to one of the program's preferences. Each one of these methods takes in input a boolean value, which indicates if the caller must get the default value of the corresponding variable, or the actual one. Method that returns the path of the training set directory.

Parameters:
defaultValue Boolean parameter that indicates if what must be returned is the default value (true) or the actual one (false).
Returns:
The path of the training set directory.

int documentclassifier.DocumentClassifierApp.getKFoldMaximum (  )  [protected]

Method that returns the maximum value of K for K-Fold cross validation, dependant on the dimension of the training set.

This value is used by the class PreferencesDialog during the drawing of its GUI, to define the 'MaxValue' property of the JSlider associated to the value of K-Fold.

Returns:
The maximum value of K for K-Fold cross validation.

synchronized boolean documentclassifier.DocumentClassifierApp.generateTrainingSet ( String  path  )  throws Exception [protected]

Method that (Re)generates the training set from the specified input directory. The documents inside this directory must be organized inside one or more subdirectories, one for each category of the training set, and having the name of this. It is possible to have documents that belong to more than one category at the same time, by putting a copy of the same document in every subdirectory corresponding to one of the categories it belongs to. This method is declared as 'synchronized', to forbid other threads from executing in parallel one of the other two synchronized methods of this class, while the training set is being (re)generated.

Parameters:
path The path of the directory containing the training set.
Returns:
A boolean value indicating if the generation of the training set has completed without errors (true), or not (false).
Exceptions:
java.lang.Exception. 

First of all, a new set of subsets of documents is created, without overwriting the current training set. If at the end of the method there hasn't been any error, the value of the variable which contains the reference to the current training set will be changed with the reference to the new one.

A new instance of the class Document is created, which represents the current document read from the file system.

If the same document (that is, a document with the same text and title) is already inside the training set, but in another category than the one corresponding to the current directory-->Instead of adding a duplicated instance of it in another category, the name of the current category is added to the set of categories of the document already present in the training set, and then a reference to its instance is added to the training set's category currently being inspected, creating in this way a graph structure (as opposed to a tree one, where every document can belong to one and only one category, which can be though as its father). So, to summarize, for each document of the training set there is only one instance, but this can be put in more than one category.

The variable 'nuovoDocumento' contains the reference to the document already present in the training set.

If I must add a new document to the training set-->I increment the variable that memorizes its total dimension.

In any case, a reference to an instance of the class 'Document' (a new one, or an already existing one) is added to the current category.

I make sure that the training set cannot be modified from this moment on.

From this moment the variable 'trainingSet' points to the new training set just created. The previous reference is then lost.

Here is the call graph for this function:

synchronized Set<Set<Document> > documentclassifier.DocumentClassifierApp.getTrainingSet (  )  [protected]

This method returns a reference to the current training set. It is declared as 'synchronized' to avoid that, if another thread is in the meantime executing one of the other two synchronized methods of the class (for example if the training set is being regenerated), the reference to the current training set is concurrently accessed, reference that for sure will change once the method generateTrainingSet will finish, making the previous reference invalid.

Returns:
A reference to the current training set, or null if this hasn't yet been generated.

synchronized int documentclassifier.DocumentClassifierApp.getTrainingSetSize (  )  [protected]

This method returns the total dimension of the current training set, that is the number of different documents thereby present. It is declared as 'synchronized' for the same reasons of the previous method.

Returns:
The total dimension of the current training set, or 0 if this hasn't yet been created.

Member Data Documentation

final Preferences documentclassifier.DocumentClassifierApp.preferences = Preferences.userRoot() [static, private]

This is a variabile that contains a reference to the global application's preferences node. In this case, the reference is to the node of the user currently running the application, which can be implemented in a different way depending by the platform where the program is being executed (for example as an hidden file inside the $HOME directory in Unix systems, or as registry keys for Windows systems). Every method of this or of other classes that want to access (reading or writing) the values of the preferences, do this using the methods get and put of this variable. In this way we added an abstraction level for the access to the preferences, and if we would decide to change the preferences node containing the values of interest for this application, we'll just have to change the following line.
